required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of a Berry Oil Cream on Atopic Eczema and Skin
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Berry Oil Cream on Atopic Eczema and Skin

brief_summary.textblock: Atopic eczema is a chronic inflammatory skin disease associated with itch and inflammatory lesions in typical skin areas. The objective of this study is to investigate the effects of a cream containing berry and plant oils and humectants on atopic eczema and dry skin.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study was suspended due to Covid-19 situation.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: Study has two parts. In part 1 the participants, care provider and outcome assessor know which treatment is given to each skin area. In part 2 participant, care provider, investigator and outcome assessor do not know which treatment is given to each skin area. Masking is done by identical cream tubes.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in severity of atopic eczema
primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1: Baseline, 2 weeks. Part 2: Baseline, 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Objective local Scoring Atopic Dermatitis (SCORAD) index. Scale range for objective local scorad in study part 1 (chosen eczema lesion) 0-63, in study part 2 (body half) 0-73. Decrease indicates better outcome/ milder symptoms.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1: Baseline, 2 weeks. Part 2: Baseline, 2 weeks, 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Modified Patient Oriented Eczema Measure (POEM) questionnaire. Scale range: 0-24. Decrease indicates better outcome/ milder symptoms.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1: Baseline, 2 weeks. Part 2: Baseline, 2 weeks, 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Visual Analog Scale (VAS) evaluation. Scale range 0-10. Decrease indicates better outcome/ milder symptoms.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1: Baseline, 2 weeks. Part 2: Baseline, 2 weeks, 5 weeks
Part 1: Baseline, 2 weeks. Part 2: Baseline, 2 weeks, 5 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of moisture (capacitance, proportional to water content of skin)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1: Baseline, 2 weeks. Part 2: Baseline, 2 weeks, 5 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of itching, dryness, flaking of skin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Part 1: Baseline, 2 weeks. Part 2: Baseline, 2 weeks, 5 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Symptom logbooks: daily scoring from 0 (no symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms)

arm_group.description: Study part 1: Administered to a chosen eczema lesion on randomized body half 1-2 times/d or more frequently (use reported to study logbook) for two weeks. Also administered to forearm (randomized body half) twice/d for two weeks. Study part 2: Administered to randomized body half 1-2 times/d for five weeks.
Study part 1: A chosen eczema lesion on randomized body half is an untreated control for two weeks. Also one forearm (on randomized body half) is a control with no treatment for two weeks.
A commercial reference cream, not containing berry and plant oils. Study part 2: Administered to randomized body half 1-2 times/d for five weeks.

intervention.description: Cream containing berry and plant oils and humectants; a medical device product in development
Commercial refence cream not containing berry and plant oils.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Atopic Eczema (mild or medium severity)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other serious skin conditions (for example psoriasis)
- Known hypersensitivity to ingredients of the study creams
- Medication seriously affecting immune function
